pullRequest.body:
The image of an inner regular measure under left/right multiplication is again inner regular.

---

nodes.body:
Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7886084037/job/21518588676)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7886084037/job/21518588336)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7886084037/job/21518588516)
LGTM regarding use of `smul`, but someone more familiar with measure theory should merge it.
Do we already have the `left` version?

Added it. Because it is not a simple special case of `innerRegular_map_smul`, I proved it using `InnerRegular.map_of_continuous` and also changed the proof of `map_mul_right` to be analogous to the left version.

I don't understand what you mean: this proof works just fine:
```lean
/-- The image of an inner regular measure under left multiplication is again inner regular. -/
@[to_additive "The image of an inner regular measure under left addition is again inner regular."]
instance innerRegular_map_mul_left [BorelSpace G] [TopologicalGroup G] [InnerRegular μ] (g : G) :
    InnerRegular (Measure.map (g * ·) μ) := innerRegular_map_smul g

/-- The image of an inner regular measure under right multiplication is again inner regular. -/
@[to_additive "The image of an inner regular measure under right addition is again inner regular."]
instance innerRegular_map_mul_right [BorelSpace G] [TopologicalGroup G] [InnerRegular μ] (g : G) :
    InnerRegular (Measure.map (· * g) μ) := innerRegular_map_smul (MulOpposite.op g)
```

Your proof is fine too though.
You're right, for some reason I thought it didn't compile.
Does this actually need `α` to be a group? I would expect a monoid is sufficient.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: innerRegular_map_mul

nodes.body: LGTM regarding use of `smul`, but someone more familiar with measure theory should merge it.

source.title: feat: Modular Character of a locally compact group
